intro: Exostema obovatum, commonly known as the broad-ovate exostema, is a unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are typically broad and ovate in shape. The plant belongs to the family Cactaceae and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a short, cylindrical stem and spines that help in reducing water loss. The flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, bloom during the warmer months and attract various pollinators.
